p: Crude methanolic extract of E. suberosa (Roxb) bark and its fractions were taken in a test tube separately and treated with 2 mL of glacial acetic acid, respectively. To the test tubes, 1 mL FeCl 3 followed by 1 mL of concentration sulfuric acid were added, resulting in the formation of reddish black layer that indicated the presence of cardiac glycosides.[ 16]
